channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 3 Steps to Buying Your First (or Next) Small Multifamily Property
item.description: Small multifamily real estate investing could be your quickest path to financial freedom. These properties, from duplexes to quadplexes, typically offer higher cash flow and scaling opportunities than traditional single-family […]

item.title: The EU’s AI Act is now in force
item.description: The European Union's risk-based regulation for applications of artificial intelligence has come into force starting from today. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Facing Rollbacks, Criminal Justice Reformers Argue Policies Make People Safer
item.description: Advocates are refining their rebuttal to “tough on crime” messaging: Don’t focus on punishment, but on reforms that improve public safety.

item.title: THE HUGE Downside of No-Income-Tax States and a Hidden Housing Market Threat
item.description: Why is everyone ignoring this one severe housing market trend, what does a 2008 crash predictor think will happen in 2025, and why are homes starting to sit longer on […]

item.title: Healx, an AI-enabled drug discovery platform for rare diseases, raises $47M
item.description: The company also said it has received regulatory clearance to start Phase 2 clinical trials for a new drug in the U.S. later this year. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drawing Attention
item.description: News Inside Issue 17 features the opinions of justice-affected people on Trump’s felonies, and a nonfiction comic about death penalty mitigation.

item.title: The Fed Is Planning to Cut Rates Soon. Here’s How Investors Should Prepare.
item.description: All signs seem to point to a September federal rate cut. It's likely to be the first step toward a revived housing market, but how should investors prepare?

item.title: EU greenlights HPE’s $14B Juniper Networks acquisition
item.description: The European Commission (EC) has given the go-ahead to HPE's planned megabucks acquisition of Juniper Networks. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: These Private Centers Lack Oversight. Cuyahoga County Judges Send Kids Anyway.
item.description: Courts are increasingly sending children to private youth care centers, spending millions while detention center overcrowding persists.

item.title: Why I’m De-Emphasizing Multifamily, and What I’m Investing In Instead
item.description: Multifamily has had its problems, and while Brian is still looking at some deals, he's turned his attention to these other assets.

item.title: Zuckerberg says Meta will need 10x more computing power to train Llama 4 than Llama 3
item.description: Meta, which develops one of the biggest foundational open-source large language models, Llama, believes it will need significantly more computing power to train models in the future. Mark Zuckerberg said on Meta’s second-quarter earnings call on Tuesday that to train Llama 4 the company will need 10x more compute than what was needed to train […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What It Means to ‘Willie Horton’ a Political Candidate
item.description: Donald Trump supporters run their version of the original dog-whistle attack ad against Kamala Harris. Here’s the history.

item.title: 5 Reasons Commercial Real Estate is Actually the Easiest Asset Class For New Investors
item.description: Commercial real estate isn't as complicated and hard to understand as many investors think.

item.title: Axle Energy’s sprint to decarbonize the grid lights up with $9M seed led by Accel
item.description: Axle Energy is a B2B, back-end infrastructure business focused on connecting flexible assets, such as electric vehicles and home batteries, to energy markets that aren't otherwise available for consumers to dip into. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Courts Cleared Jaleel Stallings. Trump’s Campaign Pulled Him Back Into the Political Muck.
item.description: Stallings was acquitted after an encounter with police during George Floyd protests in 2020, and one officer pleaded guilty to assaulting him.
